title: Question 1
question: The skull is subdivided into two parts, which are:

options.label: Anterior face of the skull and posterior face of the skull
Skull and jaw
Neurocranium and anterior skull
Neurocranium and skeleton of the face

title: Question 2
question: The neurocranium, in adults, is formed by eight bones, which are:

options.label: Frontal, parietal, even temporal, even occipital, sphenoid and ethmoid
A frontal, even parietal, even temporal, an occipital, a sphenoid and an ethmoid
Frontal, parietal, temporal, even occipitals, even sphenoids and an ethmoid
Frontal, parietal, temporal, occipital, even sphenoids, and even ethmoids

title: Question 3
question: The skeleton of the face consists of 14 irregular bones, which are:

options.label: Lacrimal (02), nasal (02), jaw (02), zygomatic (02), palatal (02), inferior nasal concha (02), mandible (01) and vomer (01)
Lacrimal (02), nasal (02), jaw (02), zygomatic (01), palatal (01), inferior nasal concha (02), mandible (02) and vomer (02)
Lacrimal (01), nasal (01), jaw (02), zygomatic (02), palatal (03), inferior nasal concha (03), mandible (01) and vomer (01)
Lacrimal (02), nasal (02), jaw (02), zygomatic (01), palatal (02), inferior nasal concha (02), mandible (02) and vomer (01)

title: Question 4
question: Which of the following sutures does not correspond to a skull suture?

options.label: Sagittal suture
Lambdoid suture
Coronal suture
Horizontal suture

title: Question 5
question: From the anatomical reference points below, mark the alternative that corresponds to an anatomical point of the skull:

options.label: Xifoidal
Vertex
Trochanteric
Styloid

title: Question 6
question: From the bone reference points of the skull below, mark the one that corresponds to the junction of the greater sphenoid wing, scaly part of the temporal, frontal and parietal and that overlaps the anterior division path of the meningeal artery:

options.label: Bregma
Asterium
Lambda
Pterium

title: Question 7
question: The Turkish saddle consists of 03 parts, which are:

options.label: Upper portion of the saddle, lower portion of the saddle and central portion of the saddle
Front face of the saddle, rear face of the saddle and inner face of the saddle
Saddle tubercle, pituitary fossa and saddle dorsum
Saddle tubercle, anterior portion of the saddle and posterior portion of the saddle

title: Question 8
question: About the spinous foramen, it is correct to state that:

options.label: It is located posterolateral to the foramen ovale, gives way to the middle meningeal vessels and the meningeal branch of the mandibular nerve
It is located posterolateral to the foramen ovale, and from the passage to the accessory meningeal artery
It is located antero-medial to the foramen ovale, gives way to the middle meningeal vessels and the meningeal branch of the mandibular nerve
It is located antero-medial to the foramen ovale, and from the passage to the accessory meningeal artery

title: Question 9
question: About the foramen ovale, it is correct to state that:

options.label: It is a small foramen, opens superiorly in the supratemporal fossa and gives way to the vagus nerve and the middle meningeal artery
It is a large foramen, opens inferiorly in the infratemporal fossa and gives way to the mandibular nerve (NC V3) and a small accessory meningeal artery
It is a small foramen, opens inferiorly in the infratemporal fossa, and gives way to the mandibular nerve (NC V3) and the middle meningeal artery
It is a large foramen, opens superiorly in the infratemporal fossa, and gives way to the vagus nerve and the middle meningeal artery

title: Question 10
question: Which nerve is responsible for the innervation of all facial muscles?

options.label: Abducent nerve (NC VI)
Facial nerve (NC VII)
Trochlear nerve (NC IV)
Trigeminal nerve (NC V)

title: Question 11
question: Of the following muscles, which is not part of the face?

options.label: Nasal muscle
Mental muscle
Buccinator muscle
Rhomboid muscle

title: Question 12
question: (ISGH 2018) The main muscles involved with the chewing process are:

options.label: Masseter, buccinator, medial pterygoid and lateral pterygoid
Temporal, mouth angle lifter and mouth angle depressor
Masseter, temporal, medial pterygoid and lateral pterygoid
Masseter, temporal, buccinator and medial pterygoid

title: Question 13
question: The parotid plexus gives rise to five terminal branches of the facial nerve, namely:

options.label: Hypoglossal nerve, vagus nerve, zygomatic nerve, trigeminal nerve and glossopharyngeal nerve
Hypoglossal nerve, zygomatic nerve, cervical nerve, abducent nerve and trochlear nerve
Temporal nerve, zygomatic nerve, cheek nerve, marginal jaw nerve, cervical nerve
Temporal nerve, hypoglossal nerve, vagus nerve, abducent nerve and trochlear nerve

title: Question 14
question: Which of the following arteries is not part of the vascularization of the face?

options.label: Obturator artery
Angular artery
Occipital artery
Mental artery

title: Question 15
question: Of the following bones, which are classified as pneumatic bones?

options.label: Zygomatic bone, sphenoid bone, occipital bone, parietal bone and nasal bone
Zygomatic bone, occipital bone, mandibular bone, nasal bone and lacrimal bone
Frontal bone, upper jaw bone, ethmoid bone, sphenoid bone and temporal bone
Frontal bone, nasal bone, ethmoid bone, sphenoid bone and parietal bone

title: Question 16
question: Of the options below, which one does not correspond to a structure found on the side wall of the cavernous sinus?

options.label: Oculomotor nerve
Trochlear nerve
Trigeminal nerve
Abducent nerve

title: Question 17
question: The brain is composed of:

options.label: Brain, cerebellum, and brainstem (midbrain, bridge, and medulla)
Brain, cerebellum and hypothalamus
Brain, hypothalamus and brainstem (midbrain, bridge and medulla)
Brain, bridge, bulb and hypothalamus

title: Question 18
question: The ventricular system of the brain is composed of:

options.label: 02 lateral ventricles, 3rd and 4th frontal ventricles and through the midbrain aqueduct
02 lateral ventricles, from the 3rd and 4th median ventricles and through the midbrain aqueduct
02 lateral ventricles, 01 frontal ventricle and 01 occipital ventricle
04 lateral ventricles, 02 frontal ventricles, 02 occipital ventricles and through the midbrain aqueduct

title: Question 19
question: From the arteries responsible for brain vascularization below, select the one formed by the union of the vertebral arteries:

options.label: Anterior Communicating Artery
Basilar Artery
Posterior Cerebral Artery
Internal Carotid Artery

title: Question 20
question: The arterial circle of the brain, is formed by:

options.label: Internal and external carotid arteries, anterior and posterior cerebral arteries and posterior communicating artery
Internal and external carotid arteries, anterior brain arteries, anterior communicating arteries and meningeal arteries
Posterior cerebral arteries, middle meningeal artery, anterior communicating arteries, internal carotid arteries and anterior cerebral arteries
Posterior cerebral arteries, posterior communicating arteries, internal carotid arteries, anterior cerebral arteries, and anterior communicating arteries
